lead_paragraph: The Kremlin repeated its longstanding denial that any Russian troops had been deployed across the border, despite growing evidence to the contrary.

headline.print_headline: Kiev Claims to Capture 2 Soldiers of Russia
headline.main: Ukraine Says It Has Captured 2 Russian Soldiers

snippet: The Kremlin repeated its longstanding denial that any Russian troops had been deployed across the border, despite growing evidence to the contrary.
abstract: Ukrainian government announces capture of Russian soldiers Yevgeny Yerofeyev and Aleksandr Aleksandrov near city of Luhansk, stronghold of pro-Russian rebels; Russian Pres Vladimir Putin reiterates denial that troops have been deployed in Ukraine; Aleksandrov, in video posted to YouTube, admits to serving in country; soldiers will be tried on terrorism charges.
